SEARCH
Package utilities

Interface OldStackADT<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the elements in this stack
public interface OldStackADT<E>
An interface for the Stack Abstract Data Type (ADT).
Author:
Ethan Van De Woestyne

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • push

      void push(E element)
      Pushes an element onto the top of this stack.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to be pushed onto this stack
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null and this stack does not permit null elements
      IllegalStateException - if the stack is fixed size and is full

    • pop

      E pop()
      Removes and returns the element at the top of this stack.
      Returns:
      the element at the top of this stack
      Throws:
      EmptyStackException - if this stack is empty

    • peek

      E peek()
      Returns, but does not remove, the element at the top of this stack.
      Returns:
      the element at the top of this stack
      Throws:
      EmptyStackException - if this stack is empty

    • equals

      boolean equals(OldStackADT<E> that)
      Compares this stack with another stack for equality. Two stacks are considered equal if they contain the same elements in the same order.
      Parameters:
      that - the stack to be compared for equality with this stack
      Returns:
      true if the stacks are equal, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified stack is null

    • iterator

      Iterator<E> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the elements in this stack in proper sequence (from top to bottom element).
      Returns:
      an iterator over the elements in this stack in proper sequence

    • toArray

      Object[] toArray()
      Returns an array containing all of the elements in this stack in proper sequence (from top to bottom element).
      Returns:
      an array containing all of the elements in this stack in proper sequence

    • search

      int search(E element)
      Returns the 1-based position where an element is on this stack. If the element occurs multiple times on the stack, the position closest to the top is returned.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to search for
      Returns:
      the 1-based position from the top of the stack where the element is located; -1 if the element is not found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null and this stack does not permit null elements

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this stack.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in this stack

    • toArray

      E[] toArray(E[] copy)
      Returns an array containing all of the elements in this stack in proper sequence (from top to bottom element). The runtime type of the returned array is of specified array.
      Parameters:
      copy - the array into which the elements are to be stored, otherwise a new array of the same runtime type is allocated
      Returns:
      an array containing all of the elements in this stack in proper sequence
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified array is null

    • contains

      boolean contains(E obj)
      Returns true if this stack contains the specified element.
      Parameters:
      obj - element whose presence in this stack is to be tested
      Returns:
      true if this stack contains the specified element, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified element is null and this stack does not permit null elements

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this stack contains no elements.
      Returns:
      true if this stack contains no elements, false otherwise

    • clear

      boolean clear()
      Removes all elements from this stack. The stack will be empty after this method returns.
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful, false otherwise
